result.execSummary:
The defendant Lynn M. COOPER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment and/or job search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Write apology letters to all the organizations who will not benefit from the Van's Athletic Association as listed by Mr. Prickett.   Agent to approve letters.  

Hold no job or position or volunteer where she is responsible for finances.  

Assign her Federal and State tax returns over to Chief's Club

Submit DNA sample.

Defendant does not qualify for representation by the public defender.  Court reviews paperwork for a court appointed attorney.  Court finds the defendant indigent and will appoint Attorney Phil Hoff as counsel of record.  Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 02-13-15 at 11:00 a.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with Van's Athletic Club.  Bail furnished.   
Minutes.

RE:  Vans Athletic Club, between 01-01-10 and 12-31-13.
Initial appearance is set for 01-26-15 at 2:30 p.m.
